link_desc:
Introduction

This template is an evolution of Sergei Averichev's Template SNMP Cisco WS3750.

It is known to work with Zabbix server 4.4 and IOS 03.06.06E on a Cisco WS3850-24T.

It uses some OIDs, external script echo.something and value mapping ciscoEnvMonState from Jean-Jacques Martrès ZBX-CISCO-ENVMON.

Changes:

  • Changed "Device description" to "Device model name" and fixed using ZBX-CISCO-ENVMON OID.
  • Fixed "Device serial number" using ZBX-CISCO-ENVMON OID.
  • Removed item CPU (removed CPU triggers and graph)
  • Removed item Device firmware version.
  • Removed item Device hardware version.
  • Linked "Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB SNMPv2" (restored CPU items).
  • 28 Jun 2020
    • Added description to interface names
    • Fixed interface graph prototype. Added error and discarded packets
  • 8 Jan 2021
    • Fixed spurious "Incoming traffic on interface ... exceed 80% for the last 5 minutes" notifications by re-modelling the trigger prototype based on "Template Module Interfaces SNMPv2"
    • Fixed IFNAME OID
    • Changed IF.UTIL.MAX from 80% to 90% (for consistency with "Template Module Interfaces SNMPv2")

Installation

Administration > General > Value mapping
o Name: ciscoEnvMonState
o Mappings
o Value: 1 > normal
o Value: 2 > warning
o Value: 3 > critical
o Value: 4 > shutdown
o Value: 5 > notPresent
o Value: 6 > notFunctioning
o Add

Create executable script echo.something in your external scripts directory (default /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts)

#!/bin/sh
#
#begin
#Script: echo.something
#Version: 2.0
#Author: Jean-Jacques Martr?s (jjmartres |at| gmail |dot| com)
#Description: This script echo a string
#License: GPL2
#
#This script is intended for use with Zabbix > 2.0
#
#USAGE:
#  as a script:      echo.somthing "some string"
#  as an item:       echo.something["some string"]

[ -z "$@" ] && exit 1
echo "$@"

Download the file (link below).

Configuration > Templates > Import > browse to the downloaded file > Import

Configure a host > Templates > Link new templates > search for Template SNMP Cisco WS3850-24T > Add

After allowing time for discovery, Configuration > > Items > State: Not supported > Apply. Disable the unsupported items.

Bugs

  • No item for device firmware version
  • No item for device hardware version
  • Many discovered items are not supported
author: Charles M Atkinson
